nav.roadmapDesc: See what we are building next

hero.title: Computational Analysis & Design
hero.description: Desktop application for designing and analyzing open channel hydraulic structures. Powerful CAD engine with hydraulic analysis tools in one integrated environment.

features.title: Everything You Need for Hydraulic Analysis
features.description: From open channel flow to hydraulic structures, CADHY provides comprehensive tools for hydraulic engineering.

3dModeling.title: 3D Channel Modeling
3dModeling.description: Create rectangular, trapezoidal, and triangular open channels with real-time 3D visualization.

hydraulicAnalysis.title: Hydraulic Analysis
hydraulicAnalysis.description: Calculate normal depth, critical depth, Froude number, and flow characteristics using Manning's equation.

structures.title: Hydraulic Structures
structures.description: Design transitions, drops, chutes, and energy dissipation basins (USBR Types I-IV, SAF).

waterSurface.title: Water Surface Profiles
waterSurface.description: Compute gradually varied flow (GVF) profiles using the Standard Step Method with M1, M2, S1, S2 classification.

cadExport.title: CAD Export
cadExport.description: Export geometry to STL, OBJ, STEP, and glTF formats for use in other CAD software.

aiAssistant.title: AI Assistant
aiAssistant.description: Multi-provider support (Claude, GPT, Gemini) with streaming responses to help with hydraulic calculations.

changelog.title: What's New
changelog.description: Latest updates and improvements to CADHY.
changelog.pageDescription: All updates, improvements, and fixes for CADHY.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Common questions about CADHY and hydraulic engineering.

download.title: Download CADHY
download.description: Available for macOS and Windows. Linux coming soon.
download.errorFetching: Unable to fetch releases from GitHub. Please visit the releases page directly:

roadmap.title: What's Next
roadmap.description: Our development roadmap. Track completed milestones and upcoming features.

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.content: CADHY ("we", "our", or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and safeguard your information when you use our desktop application and website.

informationWeCollect.title: 2. Information We Collect
informationWeCollect.intro: CADHY is designed with privacy in mind. We collect minimal data:

localData.label: Local Data:
localData.content: All project files, calculations, and settings are stored locally on your device. We do not have access to your project data.

aiFeatures.label: AI Features:
aiFeatures.content: If you use the AI assistant, your prompts are sent to third-party AI providers (Anthropic, OpenAI, or Google) using your own API keys. We do not store or have access to these conversations.

updateChecks.label: Update Checks:
updateChecks.content: The application may check for updates, which involves connecting to our GitHub repository. This does not transmit any personal information.

websiteAnalytics.label: Website Analytics:
websiteAnalytics.content: Our website may use basic analytics to understand visitor patterns. No personally identifiable information is collected.

howWeUse.title: 3. How We Use Your Information
howWeUse.intro: Since we collect minimal data, our use is limited to:
items: Providing application updates and security patches
Responding to support requests you initiate

thirdParty.title: 4. Third-Party Services
thirdParty.intro: CADHY integrates with optional third-party services:

aiProviders.label: AI Providers:
aiProviders.content: When using AI features, your data is subject to the privacy policies of Anthropic, OpenAI, or Google, depending on which provider you configure.

github.label: GitHub:
github.content: Updates and releases are distributed through GitHub. Their privacy policy applies to interactions with their platform.

dataSecurity.title: 5. Data Security
dataSecurity.content: Your project data remains on your local device. We recommend following standard security practices: keeping your operating system updated, using strong passwords, and backing up your project files regularly.

yourRights.title: 6. Your Rights
yourRights.content: Since we don't collect personal data, there is no personal information for us to provide, modify, or delete. Your project files are entirely under your control on your local device.

childrensPrivacy.title: 7. Children's Privacy
childrensPrivacy.content: CADHY is professional engineering software not directed at children under 13. We do not knowingly collect information from children.

changes.title: 8. Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date.

contact.title: 9. Contact Us
contact.content: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, please open an issue on our

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By downloading, installing, or using CADHY ("the Software"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, do not use the Software.

license.title: 2. License Grant
license.intro: Subject to these Terms, we grant you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use the Software for personal and professional purposes.
items: Reverse engineer, decompile, or disassemble the Software
Modify, adapt, or create derivative works based on the Software
Distribute, sublicense, lease, or lend the Software to third parties
Remove or alter any proprietary notices or labels
Use the Software for any unlawful purpose

intellectualProperty.title: 3. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: CADHY and all related intellectual property rights are owned by us. The Software includes components built with open-source libraries (OpenCASCADE, Tauri, React, etc.) which retain their respective licenses. Your use of these components is subject to their individual license terms.

userContent.title: 4. User Content
userContent.content: You retain all rights to the projects, designs, and data you create using CADHY. We claim no ownership over your work product. Your files are stored locally on your device and are your responsibility to backup and secure.

thirdPartyServices.title: 5. Third-Party Services
thirdPartyServices.content: CADHY may integrate with third-party services (AI providers, GitHub). Your use of these services is subject to their respective terms and conditions. We are not responsible for the availability, accuracy, or content of third-party services.

disclaimer.title: 6. Disclaimer of Warranties
disclaimer.content1: THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND. WE DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND NON-INFRINGEMENT.
disclaimer.content2: CADHY is engineering software intended to assist professionals. All calculations, analyses, and designs should be independently verified by qualified engineers. We do not guarantee the accuracy of any calculations or results.

liability.title: 7. Limitation of Liability
liability.content1: TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, WE SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, OR ANY LOSS OF PROFITS, DATA, OR GOODWILL, ARISING FROM YOUR USE OF THE SOFTWARE.
liability.content2: You acknowledge that hydraulic engineering involves complex calculations and real-world conditions that software cannot fully replicate. You assume all responsibility for the application of results produced by the Software.

updates.title: 8. Updates and Modifications
updates.content: We may release updates, patches, or new versions of the Software at our discretion. We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue the Software at any time without notice.

termination.title: 9. Termination
termination.content: We may terminate your license to use the Software at any time if you violate these Terms. Upon termination, you must cease all use of the Software and delete all copies.

governingLaw.title: 10. Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with applicable laws, without regard to conflict of law principles.

changesToTerms.title: 11. Changes to Terms
changesToTerms.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. Continued use of the Software after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified Terms.

contact.title: 12. Contact
contact.content: For questions about these Terms, please open an issue on our
